oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Woven red silk officer's sash belonging to Lt. William H. Sloan, Co. A, 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1st Lt. William H. Sloan of Monroe County, Tenn. in the 3rd Tenn. Cav. Regt. USA. owned this officer's red silk sash with tassels. Ideally, the sash was worn under the waist belt and was another symbol of officer rank. When serving as Officer of the Day, the sash was worn suspended over the right shoulder and tied at the waist to signify that temporary duty.
